page.title: 05Communications
page.content: The Post office is in Queen Street. They don't have a sorting office, sorting is done at Shrewbury. The post boxes are dotted about everywhere. They deliver every day except Sunday. They deliver in a van or on a bike. The Clive Library is named after Robert Clive. It was opened in 1974. It has about 20,000 books and serves a population of about 15,000. The Library provides a free service. It also provides topic books for schools. They have a mobile library which visits villages round Market Drayton. You can also borrow records from the library and regular displays are mounted in the library. It has two full time staff and four part time.
